channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: A warrior touched by tragedy - Terry Yorath obituary
item.description: Former Wales captain and manager Terry Yorath, who has died aged 75, had a glittering career, but his life was deeply affected by two tragedies.

item.title: What is Man Utd's 'DNA' and does it really matter?
item.description: As Manchester United look for Ruben Amorim's successor, Phil McNulty asks if a club's so-called "DNA" is actually relevant?

item.title: 'We're a laughing stock' - Man Utd fans to protest
item.description: An influential Manchester United fan group is planning a protest against the ownership, which it accuses of "turning the club into a circus".

item.title: Sutton's FA Cup third-round predictions v DJ and producer Shadow Child
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on DJ and producer Shadow Child - and AI - with his predictions for all 32 FA Cup third-round ties.

item.title: 'A gift I can't repay' - McDonald on playing with brother's kidney
item.description: Five years after receiving a kidney from his brother, Exeter midfielder Kevin McDonald is preparing to face Manchester City in the FA Cup.

item.title: Mourinho makes Benfica players sleep at training ground
item.description: Jose Mourinho takes his players to stay at Benfica's training ground after they lose against Braga in the League Cup semi-final.

item.title: 'Young leader' Romero defended by under-fire Frank
item.description: Tottenham head coach Thomas Frank defends captain Cristian Romero after he appeared to take aim at the club's hierarchy.

item.title: What next for Arsenal's Nwaneri after season of frustration?
item.description: Ethan Nwaneri had a breakout season last term - but the young Arsenal forward is in a fight for the game time needed to fulfil his promise.

item.title: 'Exactly where we want to be' - Hearts keep calm amid Old Firm noise
item.description: After a tumultuous week at Celtic and continued transfer talk at the champions and rivals Rangers, Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts appear well prepared for the second half of the season.

item.title: Algeria apologises after player mocks Congolese superfan dressed as pan-African hero
item.description: Michel Nkuka Mboladinga stood motionless throughout DR Congo's Afcon matches in tribute to Patrice Lumumba.

item.title: Newcastle score twice in stoppage time to win seven-goal thriller
item.description: Harvey Barnes scores twice as Newcastle come from behind to beat Leeds in a dramatic seven-goal thriller at St James' Park.

item.title: Semenyo strikes late as Bournemouth edge out Spurs
item.description: Antoine Semenyo scores a stunning late winner in what is likely his final game for Bournemouth as they beat Tottenham in dramatic fashion at Vitality Stadium.

item.title: Sesko scores twice but Burnley fight back to hold Man Utd
item.description: Manchester United are denied victory in their first game since the sacking of head coach Ruben Amorim as relegation-threatened Burnley fight back to claim only their third point in 12 games.

item.title: Wilson goal helps Fulham beat 10-man Chelsea
item.description: New Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior watched from the stands as Harry Wilson's fine finish condemns his team to defeat by west London rivals Fulham at Craven Cottage.

item.title: Thiago scores twice as Brentford beat Sunderland
item.description: Igor Thiago scores twice to continue his excellent recent form as Brentford sweep Sunderland aside at the Gtech Community Stadium.

item.title: Man City draw with Brighton as title bid continues to falter
item.description: Manchester City make it three games without a win, after Brighton's Kaoru Mitoma scores from outside the box to cancel out Erling Haaland's first-half penalty.

item.title: Mane strike gives Wolves deserved draw against nine-man Everton
item.description: Mateus Mane's cool finish gives Wolves a deserved draw away at Everton who had Michael Keane and Jack Grealish sent off in the second half at the Hill Dickinson Stadium.

item.title: Palace hold on to deny Villa victory in hardâ€‘fought draw
item.description: Title challengers Aston Villa miss a chance to close the gap on Arsenal to three points as Crystal Palace's injury-hit side earn a goalless draw at Selhurst Park.

item.title: The latest winning goals in Premier League history
item.description: After Newcastle's stoppage-time victory over Leeds on Wednesday, BBC Sport lists the latest winners on record in the Premier League era.

item.title: Injured Tottenham winger Kudus out until April
item.description: Tottenham winger Mohammed Kudus is ruled out of action until after the international break in March.

item.title: Leeds United's Elland Road expansion approved
item.description: The scheme will see the club's stadium become the seventh largest football ground in England.

item.title: Bournemouth keen on Nwaneri - Thursday's gossip
item.description: Bournemouth are keen on bringing in Ethan Nwaneri from Arsenal, Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner set to hold talks over extending deal, AC Milan keen on Liverpool defender Joe Gomez, plus more.

item.title: Ex-Luton boss Bloomfield in Oxford United talks
item.description: Former Wycombe Wanderers and Luton Town boss Matt Bloomfield is in talks to become the new manager of Oxford United.

item.title: Ex-Premier League referee Coote given suspended sentence over child image offence
item.description: Former football official David Coote is given a nine-month prison sentence, suspended for two years.

item.title: Wilson will have his 'pick of clubs' - MOTD's Murphy
item.description: Match of the Day's Danny Murphy analyses Fulham's Harry Wilson's current form and "intelligent" winning performance against Chelsea.

item.title: 'He's done a lot of things right' - Frank on Romero's social media post
item.description: Tottenham boss Thomas Frank defends captain Cristian Romero after the centre-back appeared to take aim at the club's hierarchy, accusing them of telling "lies" in a since edited Instagram post.

item.title: Rumoured Solskjaer return to Man Utd 'seems ridiculous'
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Stephen Warnock look at who should take charge at Manchester United following Ruben Amorim's departure earlier this week.

item.title: Defensively, we are more stable than ever - Guardiola
item.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola is pleased with his side's defensive performance highlighting Max Alleyne as "exceptional" in their 1-1 draw at home to Brighton.

item.title: Keane's actions not deliberate - Moyes on red card
item.description: Everton manager David Moyes was not happy with the decision for Michael Keane to be sent off as it was "not a deliberate action", but has no sympathy for Jack Grealish who received two quick yellow cards for dissent.

item.title: Fletcher to take charge for FA Cup - but Man Utd problems far bigger
item.description: Darren Fletcher will remain in charge of Manchester United for their FA Cup match against Brighton - as the club battle problems that go far deeper than sorting out managerial uncertainty.

item.title: Leicester sign experienced Spurs defender Neville
item.description: Leicester City sign experienced Tottenham defender Ashleigh Neville on a contract to the summer of 2027.

item.title: Swansea set to sign ex-Crystal Palace captain Ward
item.description: Joel Ward has been without a club since ending a 13-year spell at Selhurst Park last summer.

item.title: 'Beloved' coach Valakari extends St Johnstone deal
item.description: St Johnstone hand Simo Valakari a contract extension, with owner Adam Webb claiming there is "no more beloved coach in all of the UK".

item.title: Weekly sports quiz: How many managers have Man Utd had since Ferguson?
item.description: How much attention have you paid to what's happened in the world of sport over the past seven days?

item.title: West Ham sign Juventus defender Cascarino on loan
item.description: France defender Estelle Cascarino becomes Rita Guarino's first signing since her appointment last month.

item.title: A big week? Brighton draw is 'punch in ribs' for Man City
item.description: With Manchester City's crucial month beginning badly, Pep Guardiola is left to hope that their campaign is not derailing in similar fashion to last season.

item.title: Wrexham finally get their wish as Forest tie awaits
item.description: Wrexham will face Premier League opposition for the first time under Phil Parkinson when they host Nottingham Forest at Stok Cae Ras on Friday night in the FA Cup third round.

item.title: An Arsenal coffee cup and more pain for under-pressure Frank
item.description: Spurs boss Thomas Frank under more pressure and scrutiny after holding Arsenal-branded cup before 3-2 defeat by Bournemouth that left side 14th in Premier League.

item.title: Discipline, consistency & harmony - Rosenior's Chelsea to-do list as slide continues
item.description: New Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior was optimistic when arriving, but Wednesday's 2-1 defeat at Fulham underlines the scale of the task ahead.

item.title: Ex-Palace boss Kaminski named SK Brann head coach
item.description: Former Crystal Palace manager Laura Kaminski is named head coach of Norwegian club SK Brann.

item.title: Why is Cucurella only getting a one-match ban?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Chelsea left-back Marc Cucurella will only get a one-match suspension following his red against Fulham

item.title: Brilliant Brazilian and defying the odds - Brentford's European charge
item.description: With four wins in five games, and a Brazilian striker banging in the goals, Brentford fans are dreaming of the Champions League.

item.title: Man Utd did more than enough to win - Fletcher
item.description: Manchester United Interim manager Darren Fletcher says they created enough chances to have beaten Burnley after their 2-2 draw at Turf Moor.

item.title: Leeds were 'naive' in 'heartbreaking' loss - Farke
item.description: Leeds manager Daniel Farke believes his team's game management was "naive" in a "heartbreaking" loss against Newcastle which ends their seven game unbeaten run.

item.title: Frank reflects on 'extremely painful' result at Bournemouth
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur boss Thomas Frank reflects on "painful" loss to Bournemouth following a stunning late goal from Antoine Semenyo.

item.title: Newcastle resilience pleases Howe after dramatic win over Leeds
item.description: Newcastle boss Eddie Howe admits there are plenty of things his side must work on but is nonetheless delighted with a dramatic win over Leeds at St James' Park.

item.title: Silva delighted with 'incredible' win over Chelsea
item.description: Fulham boss Marco Silva is delighted after Harry Wilson's 81st-minute goal gives his side a deserved 2-1 win over 10-man Chelsea at Craven Cottage.

item.title: Iraola praises Semenyo as 'one of the best players' he's coached
item.description: AFC Bournemouth boss Andoni Iraola says "football has been fair and given him a perfect moment" as Antoine Semenyo scores a late winner on his final appearance for the Cherries.

item.title: Former England boss Keegan diagnosed with cancer
item.description: Former England striker and manager Kevin Keegan has been diagnosed with cancer and is receiving treatment.

item.title: West Brom interested in ex-Man Utd coach Ramsay
item.description: West Bromwich Albion are interested in former Manchester United coach Eric Ramsay as they look to fill their managerial vacancy.

item.title: Ex-Wales rugby star Owens joins new FAW committee
item.description: Ex-Wales rugby union captain Ken Owens will be part of the Football Association of Wales' new strategic advisory committee.

item.title: 'Like a movie' - Semenyo enjoys fairytale farewell
item.description: Antoine Semenyo could not have dreamed of a better ending to his Bournemouth career as his late winner against Spurs ends the Cherries' long winless run.

item.title: Ex-Tottenham and England forward Chivers dies aged 80
item.description: Former Tottenham and England forward Martin Chivers dies at the age of 80.

item.title: Fifa will scan World Cup players to make offside avatars
item.description: Fifa is to create AI-enabled 3D avatars of all players at the World Cup to enhance semi-automated offside technology.

item.title: How to follow the FA Cup on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the FA Cup third round on TV and radio this weekend.

item.title: 'Nobody can get hold of him' - what happened to David Batty?
item.description: England midfielder David Batty vowed to have "nothing to do with the football industry" after retirement. As his former clubs Newcastle and Leeds prepare to meet, BBC Sport asks: what happened to him?

item.title: Their dad's the new interim boss - meet Man Utd teenage twins Tyler and Jack Fletcher
item.description: BBC Sport profiles twin brothers Tyler and Jack Fletcher, who will hope to get minutes at Manchester United under interim head coach and father Darren

item.title: Tactics, transfers and turmoil - inside the fall of Amorim
item.description: After 14 months, Ruben Amorim has been sacked by Manchester United - but where did it all go wrong?

item.title: 'Appointing Nancy one of clueless Celtic's greatest blunders'
item.description: There is "no apparent big picture view at Celtic", argues BBC Sport Scotland's Tom English as Wilfried Nancy and Paul Tisdale exit the ailing champions.

item.title: Can you name the Premier League's oldest ever players?
item.description: James Milner could make a Premier League appearance after his 40th birthday on Wednesday. Can you name the other 18 players to have done so?

item.title: What is the Women's Champions Cup and who will Arsenal play?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Fifa's new Women's Champions Cup.

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Why is the Spanish Super Cup played in Saudi Arabia?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why the Spanish Super Cup is being played in Saudi Arabia.

item.title: How is Premier League doing in race for five Champions League places?
item.description: With the top three in the Premier League pulling away, could fifth be enough for Champions League football again?

item.title: How does Maresca's Chelsea record compare?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore Enzo Maresca's records as Chelsea manager and how it compared to previous bosses.

item.title: Why is the Dundee derby not part of the 3pm blackout?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at why the Dundee derby is being shown on TV despite the 3pm blackout.

item.title: Who is Bendito Mantato? Man Utd debutant profiled
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Manchester United teenager Bendito Mantato, who made his senior debut against Wolves in United's final match of 2025

item.title: 'It's a mystery' - why Premier League teams haven't played every club yet
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Premier League teams have not played every opponent yet despite being at the midway point in the season.

item.title: Is a leg break worse than an ACL tear?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the different recovery periods for common football injuries.

item.title: Askou 'happy' at Motherwell amid 'natural' speculation
item.description: Motherwell manager Jens Berthel Askou insists he is "extremely happy" at Fir Park and is looking to see how far they can take their successful season to date.

item.title: McCann backs Kilmarnock to 'catch fire' with victory
item.description: Neil McCann says one win will help Kilmarnock "catch fire" as the new manager looks to turn around the club's faltering season.

item.title: Celtic in bid to bring Kyogo back on loan - gossip
item.description: Celtic bid to bring back former hero as Rangers make offers for midfielder and left-back...

item.title: AC Milan v Como league game in Australia cancelled
item.description: A Italian league match in Australia between AC Milan and Como will no longer take place following football sanctions imposed by the Asian Football Confederation, says Serie A.

item.title: Who's leading the race for the Golden Shoe?
item.description: As the halfway mark of the 2025-26 campaign approaches, BBC Sport takes a look at the frontrunners for this season's European Golden Shoe award.

item.title: England forward Robinson re-joins Bristol City
item.description: Bristol City women re-sign forward Katie Robinson on a two-and-a-half-year deal.

item.title: Liverpool sign keeper who saved four England penalties
item.description: Liverpool sign Sweden goalkeeper Jennifer Falk on loan from BK Hacken for the rest of the season.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
